 Unfortunately, a LOT of people have a type of misconceptions similar to those that johnnyturk conveyed. They just don't realize what is really going on in the world regarding gay legislation and what does and does not exist regarding gay equality. They don't realize what exists for heterosexuals, and what is denied for homosexuals.
 
 But specifically on Johnnyturk's comments, I am familiar with this type of propagandic representation. Some anti-gay people start talking about the things that gay people CAN do in order to distract from the discrimination that EXISTS against them. It's a tactic I've seen used to try and pretend that the discrimination doesn't exist.
 
 You'll note that Johnnyturk doesn't talk about getting fired from a job because you are gay.
 He doesn't talk about military service discrimination (although he does inaccurately claim you can get any job that you want). He doesn't talk about how marriage caters to the heterosexual.
 He does inaccurately claim that gays can get civil unions and adopt, although the truth is that civil unions (or a similar form) are only available in a handful of states, and specifically recognized almost ONLY in those states.
